channel.title: A question
channel.description: Hey everyone, I have a SanDisk Sansa® c200 Series, but I've lost the installation CD to install the Software to make it be read upon Connection, so it is not read as Unknown. Can someone help me find it, or another way around it?

item.title: A question
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

Hmm, it might do the same for me, but it never has :/. oh well Thank you JME, and h44ckzor.

Read full topic

item.title: A question
item.dc:creator: @h44ckzor_pwnage h44ckzor pwnage
item.description:
@h44ckzor_pwnage wrote:

I have a sandisk mp3 player. All I do is plug it in then copy and paste the songs into the folder that comes up.

Read full topic

item.title: A question
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

Hmm…

Well I went to the website: http://sandisk.com/Retail/DriverDownloads.aspx

There is a section for sansa. They don’t have any drivers. I don’t really know what you mean though, both my parents have a sandisk mp3 player and we didn’t need to install anything. I just open up windows media player and go to the synchronization to put songs on it.

Read full topic
